audios.au: One solenoid controls the central pressurizing and venting of the valve
... the other two the connections to each supporting bellow.
When the left soleniod is actuated, compressed air flows via port 11 to the inside of the valve.
When now the two other solenoids are simultanously energised, the ports 22 and 23 to the air suspension bellows get connected to air supply and the bellows are pressurized.
When the solenoids are switched off, the pressure in the two bellows is hold.
To vent the air suspension bellows the two solenoids on the right are energized. Thus the ports 22 and 23 are vented to 3 this time.
When the two solenoids are switched off again, the pressure in both bellows is hold.
If like here a front axle valve is connected to port 21, it it also pressurized and vented, via the central pressurizing and venting of the rear axle valve.
